section.title: Increment 1

formalpara.title: Iteration 1, Test Case 1
formalpara.para: This case fails with the following error:

section.programlisting: 'Test.ll'CoDfns.Fix ':EndNamespace' ':EndNamespace' '' '' DOMAIN ERROR: Bad parameter specification: \ ⎕NA errored at int - invalid specification FFI∆INIT[4] 'PrintModuleToFile'⎕NA'int \ CoDfns|PrintModuleToFile P <0C >P'
section.simpara: Diagnosis of this error is self evident.

formalpara.title: Iteration 3, Test Case 1
formalpara.para: The Tokenize fails due to a length error when splitting comments and code. This occurs because of the scan used with a zero length string. In this case, the scan always gives back a one element result, while it is clear that the intent was to return an empty array in this case.

formalpara.title: Iteration 4, Test Case 1
formalpara.para: The Tokenize does not return a proper structure. It is instead severely mishapen.

formalpara.title: Iteration 5, Test Case 1
formalpara.para: The Tokenize returns before finishing the code because of a missing assignment statement.

formalpara.title: Iteration 6, Test Case 1
formalpara.para: The Tokenize fails to correctly identify the location of comments.

formalpara.title: Iteration 7, Test Case 1
formalpara.para: The Tokenize fails to correctly split tokens on spaces.

formalpara.title: Iteration 8, Test Case 1
formalpara.para: The Tokenize fails with a domain error when trying to wrap tokens around everything.

formalpara.title: Iteration 9, Test Case 8
formalpara.para: The Parse gives an incorrect Syntax error on valid input.

formalpara.title: Iteration 10, Test Case 1
formalpara.para: The Parse does not return the names array.

formalpara.title: Iteration 11, Test Case 5
formalpara.para: The Parse accepts more than one Nss and Nse stimuli in a namespace script.
